image.altText: a woman with brown hair speaking in front of a blue and green background

props.synopsis: Communications Minister Anika Wells says people have a right to "feel livid" following the latest Optus triple-0 outage. Follow live.

title.children: Australians should 'feel livid' about Optus triple-0 failure, minister says

image.altText: A woman uses her phone outside an Optus store as a man looks at his.

props.synopsis: Optus reveals that in addition to customers in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, two people in New South Wales were unable to connect to emergency services during the 13-hour outage last Thursday.

title.children: Optus triple-0 outage wider than first reported, CEO admits

image.altText: Liberal MP Vincent Tarzia addresses the media.

props.synopsis: The SA opposition has promised to introduce 50 cent fares for all public transport, if elected in March next year.

title.children: SA opposition promises to slash public transport fares to 50 cents if elected

image.altText: Satellite imagery of a river mouth and surrounding coastal region showing a large brown plume

props.synopsis: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

title.children: Doubts raised over link between SA's algal bloom and Murray River flood

image.altText: A red horned steer noses up to four school girls at a timber fence as one girl pats it on the nose.

props.synopsis: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

title.children: Small town school enrolments boom with chickens and cows on the curriculum

image.altText: Frank Pangello in blue tshirt and cap stands next to Vincent Tarzia at a political media conference.

props.synopsis: When Frank Pangallo announced he was joining the Liberal party, he vowed to put the blowtorch on a first-term government riding high in the polls. But barely four weeks later, the blowtorch is firmly on Pangallo instead, writes Leah MacLennan.

title.children: AI 'admin error' puts SA Liberals' star recruit in spotlight

image.altText: Two men, one holding a eucalypt tree cutting, stand on a walking track trimmed with gum trees.

props.synopsis: A unique partnership between an artist and a botanist has resulted in an old rail corridor in South Australia becoming an eucalypt forest.

title.children: Forest rail trail grows from artist and tree scientist's seedling deal

image.altText: Premier Peter Malinauskas standing with his ministers at Government House.

props.synopsis: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

title.children: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left

image.altText: Tom Koutsantonis shaking hands and smiling with SA's Governor General.

props.synopsis: Mr Koutsantonis takes the role from Stephen Mullighan, who is one of two senior ministers to resign from cabinet this week. The cabinet now has more women than men for the first time in SA's history.

title.children: Tom Koutsantonis appointed SA Treasurer amid significant cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: A man wears a pink cap, LGBTQIA+ badges pinned to his t-shirt. He stands next to a river

props.synopsis: Since homosexuality was decriminalised in South Australia half a century ago, LGBTIQA+ people say the state has made strides, but there is still some way to go towards equality.

title.children: South Australians reflect on life, 50 years after homosexuality was decriminalised

image.altText: A varroa mite on its host, a bee pupa.

props.synopsis: PIRSA says there is a chance the deadly parasite remains in the state where it was detected for the first time earlier this month.

title.children: Infected hives removed but varroa could still be in SA, authority says

image.altText: Close up image of a concrete kerb and open drain on a suburban street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who emptied drums containing hazardous chemicals into a suburban gutter — causing nearby residents to experience headaches and nausea — has been fined thousands of dollars.

title.children: Man fined for pouring 'volatile' chemicals into suburban gutter

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers holds up a Australia flag

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers won a superb gold medal in a women's high jump that was twice suspended for torrential rain on the final day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title.children: Olyslagers wins fantastic gold as rain hits final day

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson and Angelina Topic under an umbrella

props.synopsis: Eleanor Patterson did not come away with a medal at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by supporting Angelina Topić through a tough moment, she gained so much more.

title.children: How this beautiful moment made up for missing a medal for Aussie star

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

title.children: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Trump says

image.altText: Three women in a gym, squatting while holding dumbbells. In between each woman is electrical tape marking physical distancing.

props.synopsis: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

title.children: Dementia risk can be lowered with vigorous exercise, study finds

image.altText: Eddie has grey hair and a blue top looks off screen, grey stubble, looks worried, flowers behind him.

props.synopsis: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

title.children: 'Where does a pensioner get $550?' Man goes without cancer scans

image.altText: An illustration of a measles particle.

props.synopsis: So far this year, there have been 121 measles notifications across Australia — the highest number since 2019, when there were 284 notifications.

title.children: What rising cases mean for Australia's status as free of endemic measles

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren climbs out of his damaged car

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

title.children: Piastri crashes out of F1 grand prix with 'silly' mistake on lap one

image.altText: A wind turbine bent over with low white clouds around it, tall grass in the foreground.

props.synopsis: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW Nationals Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

title.children: Push for wind farm safety assessment after turbine snaps during storm

image.altText: A man in a grey suit

props.synopsis: NSW Police issued a warrant for solicitor Abdul Saddik's devices earlier this year as part of a probe into his links to figures in Sydney's underworld.

title.children: Sydney lawyer fighting police warrant over gun, drug supply evidence

image.altText: Large bottles of yellow cooking oil being filled at a factory.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of litres of used cooking oil is disposed of every year as a by-product of making some of Australia's favourite snacks, like chips — but one company is trialling a method to reduce waste.

title.children: Cooking oil turned into snack packaging in Australia-first trial

image.altText: Satellite imagery of a river mouth and surrounding coastal region showing a large brown plume

props.synopsis: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

title.children: Doubts raised over link between SA's algal bloom and Murray River flood

image.altText: An adult hand cradles the feet of a baby.

props.synopsis: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it's still deeply controversial.

title.children: 'The potential to save trillions': The controversial future of gene editing

image.altText: A white jet flying at night over a city with lights on

props.synopsis: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

title.children: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland

image.altText: a burnt converted e-bike on a train platform after it caught fire

props.synopsis: The e-bikes posing a "higher fire risk" will be banned from trains, after dozens of incidents were found to be linked to the battery technology powering them.

title.children: Commuters taking converted e-bikes on NSW trains, metro to face fines up to $1,110

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: A child safety advocate welcomes a recent decision to uphold a ban on a convicted child sex offender from two dating apps, which comes after the man tried to have the ban overturned.

title.children: 'The system is working': Tinder, Hinge ban for man convicted of possessing child abuse material

image.altText: Donald Trump stands beneath a US flag billowing in a breeze

props.synopsis: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

title.children: Republicans divided in free speech quagmire after Charlie Kirk's death

image.altText: Dayne Zorko grabs at Mason Cox's eyewear.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

title.children: Lions veteran Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Cox's glasses

image.altText: Patrick Cripps kisses the Brownlow Medal on stage

props.synopsis: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

title.children: Brownlow Medal 2025: How to follow, how it works and who might win

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump holding a pen over an executive order he just signed

props.synopsis: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.

title.children: White House says new $100k H-1B visa fees won't apply to current workers

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.

title.children: How Penrith sent a chilling reminder that nobody does it like them

image.altText: A person sits under the shade of palm trees as they look out towards the ocean.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says the weather will be as good as people in the Sunshine State can hope for at this time of year, with another wet summer on the horizon.

title.children: Sunny skies ahead for Queensland school holidays
